title: High School Sucks: A Conversation with Colin
description:
Is high school the best years of your life? Hell no, according to Greg and Colin.

Today's topics were submitted by @CHICKACHICKA54. Leave your suggestions for future conversations in the comments below.

SUBSCRIBE/LIKE/SHARE

Every Tuesday and Thursday, roommates Greg and Colin sit down, and Greg throws a random conversation topic at Colin. In return, Colin usually says something crazy and you get a chuckle. Subscribe so you don't miss the madness.

Follow us on Twitter
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/gameovergreggy
Colin - http://www.twitter.com/notaxation

#AConversationWithColin Playlist: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL85130F65C312F61E&feature=plcp

Huge thanks to Nick and Tim for filming.

transcript_chunks.text: Jane Smith doesn't like me and she's in my biology class or like who gives a **** what's up everybody Welcome to A Conversation With Colin I'm Greg and this is my roommate Colin now sometimes Colin says crazy stuff so every Tuesday and Thursday I reach into my random topic pile, pulling out, toss it at him and we talk it out for your amusement and approval if you approve, like the video subscribe to our channel so on and so forth. Colin are you ready? You're submitting for approval, like "Midnight's Delight" yeah a little fire going okay you ready mhm today's topic is High School submitted by ChickaChicka54. I stopped bringing a book bag home like mid junior year; I'm just like, 'I'm not gonna do this anymore,' you know what I mean? So I coasted by, but newspaper stuff I did, and that helped out. But like, you know, bunch of jerk-ass kids there, teachers who are way too young to be teaching us – they were getting caught up in the high school drama and stuff, like being little, they were being pricks, and it was just like, '**** off, I don't even want to deal with you.' Well, you know why that might be is because private schools don't have you don't have to pass certification to teach in a private school; you actually don't even have to have"

even want to deal with you well you know why that might be is because private schools don't have you don't have to pass certification to teach in a private school you actually don't even have to have like a teaching degree to teach in in private school because like it's up to them to like let people in so a lot of young teachers get their start or just young people get their start teaching in in private schools what would you tell yourself back in your high school days if you could talk to them right now if we could figure out to time travel to the past I don't know don't sweat it don't that's that's a great one like High School is meaningless in terms of like your social your Social Development and like what you know like you worry about what people think of you and this girl or this thing it's like it is I don't I don't remember the first thing about like being in high school anymore it's like who gives a **** it was it was college that was awesome

It was college that was awesome and college was like, like I said in the college conversation, that's four years of your life that you just can't replicate. Yeah, ever since then, no responsibilities, yeah, like no real responsibilities, just do whatever you want. You can fail out, do really well, go party, chill, and read. Like, there are people who take it too far, one way or another. Especially people who do really well in college - that's great. College is where things really matter. High School? I would recommend just studying, getting good grades, taking classes, building bridges, making good friends... don't get hung up on some stuff.
